page.title: 16SOCIAL CONCERN-HOUSING
page.content: A major cause of concern in this area of Peterlee is the sub-standard houses.When plans were made in the sixties the Peterlee Development Corporation decided to adopt unconventional Houses.by 1978 however these houses were badly in need of repair.Flat roofs leaked and wood was rotten.That year when Easington District Council took over ownership it agreed to carry out repairs estimated to cost 20 to 40 million pounds.At the present time many people are still waiting for repairs.Those who have bought their houses are to be charged Â£10,000 each for these.Another problem is the pavillion,a large concrete ornamentl structure which has become a target for vandalism and a health hazard.The council has blocked off access to it and improved it's appearance.
